Hello All,

I am new to JUnit. This is my first post.

I am passing paramet=
ers to my main method that sets values (host 
name, port etc.) for my tests=
 to run correctly. After setting the 
parameters I call: junit.textui.TestR=
unner.run( suite());
where suite is a function as: 

 public static Test su=
ite()
  {
    TestSuite retval =3D  new TestSuite();
    retval.addTest(new=
 LoginTest("testValidLoginTest"));
    retval.addTest(new LoginTest("testIn=
ValidLoginTest"));
}

I am building and running my tests through Ant:
<targ=
et name=3D"test" depends=3D"compile">
 <junit printsummary=3D"yes" haltoner=
ror=3D"yes" haltonfailure=3D"yes"

in" usefile=3D"false"/>

t"/>

name=3D"src.zip"/>

Through comm=
and line my main method gets called but it does not get 
called through ant=
.
 Now it doesn't even enter main and does not even go to 
junit.textui.Tes=
tRunner.run( suite());

How do I force it to call main since I need my para=
meters to be set.

Please help.

Thanks,
Sunil
